cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles southwest of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally north-northwest across the northwestern Caribbean today, then north into the eastern Gulf of Mexico and curving north-northeast toward the Florida west coast before moving inland across the Southeast U.S. toward South Carolina and North Carolina late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical cyclone watches in effect along the North Carolina coast at this time.
weather_observation.warning_coast: No tropical cyclone warnings in effect along the North Carolina coast at this time.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast (Englewood to Anclote River) first, then much of the Southeast coast including Georgia, South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina late week.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts are possible late Friday into Saturday, but the current 5-day probability of sustained 34-kt winds is only 8%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could bring minor to moderate coastal inundation; a surge of 2–4 ft cannot be ruled out if the center tracks near or just west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday–Saturday could produce 4–6 inches with locally higher totals, leading to flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands and dangerous rip currents are possible as the cyclone approaches.
